description: The Nigerian coastal zone sprawls a total of nine states, out of the thirty-six states of the federation, namely: Akwa-Ibom, Bayelsa, Cross River, Delta, Edo, Lagos, Ogun, Ondo and Rivers. The coastal states are estimated to account for 25% of the national population. The coastal areas stretch inland for a distance of about 15km in Lagos in the West to about 150km in the Niger Delta and about 25km East of the Niger Delta. The coastline stretches for about 853km comprising inshore waters, coastal lagoons, estuaries and mangrove especially in the Niger Delta. The zone experiences a tropical climate consisting of a rainy season (April- October) and a dry season (November- March) with diurnal temperature as high as 34 to 35Â°C and high relative humidity rarely below 60%. There are Seven (7) erosion monitoring stations in the nation.
